The fetishization of blondeness is also creepy. As a pure blooded Nordic Alpine albino, I should tell you that true blondeness comes at a cost that they seem to forget: I cannot see very clearly- my vision is better now but I was born almost blind. I cannot stay in the sun for long lest I should get burned- not to mention, the increased risk of skin cancer. Some people would even call me an alien when I was a kid- of course that was their own jealousy, so it did not affect me, because of where I was born fortunately. I have heard that they kill albinos in Africa for their body parts- arms, legs, hair. They say that the grass looks greener on the other side, but I honestly do not think that there is any advantage of being completely blonde given what it costs. Nonetheless, this is fiction so it does not matter, but a point had to be made.  The way the Japanese are glorifying blondeness is quite appalling. I am honestly very glad that I was born in Europe and not in Japan or America.
